Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient expresses feelings of anxiety, particularly when overwhelmed with work or personal responsibilities. They also wish to discuss setting boundaries to avoid taking on too much for others.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient has been opening up to their siblings about their feelings, which has led to a supportive and understanding relationship. They feel a sense of relief and connection after sharing their emotions. They also recognize the need to set boundaries with family and friends.
Physiological Observations: The patient reports experiencing tightness in the chest and a racing heart when anxious. After practicing grounding techniques, they feel calmer and more present.
Progress Evaluation: The patient shows progress in emotional openness and is beginning to implement coping strategies for anxiety. They are also recognizing the importance of setting boundaries.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is practicing deep breathing and grounding exercises to manage anxiety. They are encouraged to communicate boundaries with compassion and honesty.
Next Steps: The patient plans to set a small boundary with a friend who frequently asks for favors and will check in on their progress in the next session.
